Adam alone in paradise did grieve --
I cannot perceive this business design'd --
Plain as this canvas was, as plain we find --
Oh may our follies like the falling trees --
Beauties like princes from their very youth --
Mysterious heaven how wondrous are thy ways --
Now while my needle does my hours engage --
Tis true tis long ere I began --
Ann thou are fair divinely fair --
I read his awful name, emblazoned high --
How various her employments whom the world --
In all my vast concerns with thee --
Observe the rising lily's snowy grace --
When first my lisping accents came --
Whence did the wondrous mystic art arise.

Harvard University Asia Center, for the Harvard-Yenching Institute,
"First edition published as Chinese history : a manual, 1998"--Title page verso.

"An indispensable guide to the civilization and history of China. Introduces sources from prehistory to the present and examines the context in which the sources were produced, preserved, and received, the problems of research and interpretation associated with them, and the best, most up-to-date secondary works"--

LANGUAGE -- PEOPLE -- GEOGRAPHY & ENVIRONMENT -- GOVERNING & EDUCATING -- IDEAS, BELIEFS, LITERATURE & FINE ARTS -- AGRICULTURE, FOOD & DRINK -- TECHNOLOGY & SCIENCE -- TRADE TOPICS -- HISTORY -- PRE-QIN -- QIN-WUDAI -- SONG-QING -- EARLY TWENTIETH CENTURY -- BIBLIOGRAPHY.
Written in both English and Chinese.
